intro: Here's a list of helpful links I've found while researching Canon FD & FL lenses, roughly organized by topic.

oemHistLinks.name: 'History Hall (1970-1975)' at the Canon Camera Museum
oemHistLinks.helpText: (Canon's official guide to their company history)

lensSpecLinks.name: 'Lens Hall' at the Canon Camera Musem
lensSpecLinks.helpText: (Canon's official reference guide for their legacy equipment. A great primary resource used in this site)

lensSpecLinks.name: CanonClassics.com
lensSpecLinks.helpText: (A great reference site dedicated to classic Canon cameras and lenses)

lensSpecLinks.name: FD Lens Writeups & History at Photography in Malaysia
lensSpecLinks.helpText: (A great reference site, also has good content for Olympus OM, Nikon F and other lens systems)

lensSpecLinks.name: FL Lens Writeups & History at Photography in Malaysia
lensSpecLinks.helpText: (A great reference site, also has good content for Olympus OM, Nikon F and other lens systems)

lensSpecLinks.name: Dennis Baron's Canon FD Lens specs table
John Waller's Canon FD Lens specs table
Lens Profiles at Artaphot.ch
lensSpecLinks.helpText: (Note: Not as complete as their Minolta coverage)

reviewLinks.name: 'The Guide to Canon FD lenses on the Sony a7 series' by Phillip Reeve
Lens Reviews at Casual Photophile
reviewLinks.helpText: (High quality articles but unfortunately only covering a handful of Canon Lenses. Highly recommended also for their camera reviews and other articles)

miscLinks.name: (The Manual Focus Lenses forum at MFLenses.com
miscLinks.helpText: This is the most active forum I've found on the subject of MF lenses of all manufacturers. A good resource)
